data.title: City National Bank
data.meta_description: David Cameron is executive vice president and head of Consumer Banking at City National Bank and is a member of the company’s Executive Leadership Team and Senior Management Team.
data.text:
David Cameron is executive vice president and head of Consumer Banking at City National Bank and is a member of the company’s Executive Leadership Team and Senior Management Team. David is responsible for overseeing the bank’s branch network, as well as its consumer & preferred banking, small business banking, community banking, and mortgage & residential lending segments. He also leads City National’s commitment to fair lending and the Community Reinvestment Act. He is based in Los Angeles and manages colleagues in California, Nevada, Georgia, Virginia, New York and Washington, D.C.

David joined City National in 2005 as an associate business development officer. He spent 10 years growing his career and leading colleagues in Commercial Banking before becoming the senior vice president in charge of business banking in 2016. Under his leadership, City National has become one of the top lenders in the country for Small Business Administration 504 loans. David also successfully led his team through the Paycheck Protection Program and enabled City National to make more than 11,600 PPP loans totaling more than $2.1 billion.

David is active in the community. He serves on the board of directors for the Yosemite Conservancy Council, Pacific Coast Banking School and the Aquarium of the Pacific. He previously served as a board member of BizFed, a grassroots alliance that advocates for policies and projects that strengthen the Los Angeles regional economy. In 2024, David was named to the Los Angeles Business Journal’s annual list of “Leaders of Influence” in the banking category and the Los Angeles Times’ B2B Publishing’s list of “Visionaries in Banking.”

David earned his bachelor’s degree from the University of California, Irvine, and is a graduate of the Pacific Coast Banking School.
